alert.note: Alert for Athens; Jackson (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued March 03 at 5:41AM EST until March 04 at 4:00AM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall remains possible. * WHERE...Portions of northeast Kentucky and southeast Ohio, including the following counties, in northeast Kentucky, Boyd, Carter and Greenup. In southeast Ohio, Athens, Gallia, Jackson OH, Lawrence OH, Meigs, Morgan, Perry, Vinton and Washington. * WHEN...Through late tonight. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations such as in urban and other poor drainage areas. Low-water crossings may be flooded. Storm drains and ditches may become clogged with debris. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Rain this morning into this afternoon, followed by a round of showers and possible thunderstorms late this afternoon and this evening, could result in rainfall becoming excessive. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should any Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
